exercises.title: Split Text by Spaces
exercises.instructions: Complete the code to split text into word tokens. Replace ??? with the correct method name.
hints: What Python method separates a string by spaces?
Try .split() - it splits strings into a list
exercises.concept: Basic word tokenization using Python's built-in split method

exercises.title: Character Tokenization
exercises.instructions: Convert text into individual character tokens. Replace ??? with the right function.
hints: Which Python function converts a string to a list of characters?
list(text) splits a string into individual characters
exercises.concept: Character-level tokenization - breaking text into its smallest units

exercises.title: Count Tokens
exercises.instructions: After tokenizing, count how many tokens you have. Complete the code.
exercises.starterCode:
text = "Learn by doing"
tokens = text.split()
num_tokens = ???(tokens)
print(f"Tokens: {num_tokens}")
exercises.solution:
text = "Learn by doing"
tokens = text.split()
num_tokens = len(tokens)
print(f"Tokens: {num_tokens}")
hints: How do you count items in a Python list?
len() gives you the length of a list
exercises.concept: Understanding token count - crucial for knowing model input size
